meanings.definition: A container used to remove moisture from substances.
meanings.sent1: The desiccators in the lab helped dry out the wet chemicals.
meanings.sent2: The scientist placed the plant specimen in the desiccators to preserve it.
meanings.sent3: The desiccators were like little magic boxes that made things dry in no time.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a desiccators, sucking out any doubts or fears.
meanings.sent5: The desiccators hummed quietly as they worked their drying magic.

meanings.definition: The act of drying or dehydrating something.
meanings.sent1: The desiccators of the desert left the land parched and barren.
meanings.sent2: Proper desiccators of food can help prevent spoilage.
meanings.sent3: The desiccators of the sun turned the grapes into raisins.
meanings.sent4: His words were like desiccators, draining the enthusiasm from the room.
meanings.sent5: The desiccators of winter turned the once-green landscape into a white wonderland.

meanings.sent1: The relentless sun acted as a natural desiccators, drying up the river.
meanings.sent2: The desiccators of hope seemed to follow him wherever he went.
meanings.sent3: The desiccators of time slowly aged the old book's pages.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp wit was a desiccators, leaving no room for misunderstanding.
meanings.sent5: The desiccators of the wind turned the once lush garden into a dry wasteland.
